item.title: Adding concurrency to smalisca
item.description: When it comes to parallelism Python has some constraints which have to be taken into consideration before starting coding. I think the biggest one has to do with the Global Interpreter Lock which prevents several threads from executing Python bytecodes at once. Nevertheless you may want to apply concurrency patterns to you code in order to achieve more speed. Besides that you may want to use your cores properly otherwise you’ll end up like this:
